channel.title: Weird connection problems
channel.description:
Hi,
I just got an Axoloti Core today. I followed the Getting Started page. I loaded the library tutorial sine oscillator first. I clicked "Live", and it hung and ate up my cpu time. I looked in the process list and it was doing make and just hanging. So I closed it, unplugged and replugged in the board and started again. This time, I tried the demo>sequencing>303 patch, clicked live and it uploaded the patch. It started playing music and then in the log window it said "axoloti patch start taking too long, disconnecting", and then the program showed it was disconnected. I couldn't do anything until I unplugged the board again. I did this a few times. Now, unfortunately, it gets a control transfer failed -9 then -7 error, and does the same thing, plays stuff but but axoloti patch start taking too long, disconnecting and i'm disconnected again... Any clue what's going on? Did I do something wrong?
Thanks, -m

item.title: Weird connection problems
item.dc:creator: @mikemoretti Mike M.
item.description:
@mikemoretti wrote:

Nevermind. WIndows sucks ass. I set it up on my linux computer instead and it all just works. I hate windoze.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird connection problems
item.dc:creator: @mikemoretti Mike M.
item.description:
@mikemoretti wrote:

Hi,

I just got an Axoloti Core today. I followed the Getting Started page. I loaded the library tutorial sine oscillator first. I clicked "Live", and it hung and ate up my cpu time. I looked in the process list and it was doing make and just hanging. So I closed it, unplugged and replugged in the board and started again. I couldn't do anything until I unplugged the board again. I did this a few times. Now, unfortunately, it gets a control transfer failed -9 then -7 error, and does the same thing, plays stuff but but axoloti patch start taking too long, disconnecting and i'm disconnected again... Any clue what's going on? Did I do something wrong?

Thanks,
